alert.note: Alert for Cooper; Pettis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 8:01PM CDT until August 01 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Missouri, north central Missouri and west central Missouri, including the following counties, in central Missouri, Cooper, Howard, Pettis and Saline. In north central Missouri, Caldwell, Carroll, Chariton, Daviess and Livingston. In west central Missouri, Lafayette and Ray. * WHEN...From Midnight CDT tonight through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Thunderstorms producing locally heavy rainfall are likely within the watch area tonight. Rain amounts of 2-4 inches with locally up to 6 inches are possible within the watch area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
